interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Band of Angels (DVD) Review Date: 2017/02/13 Store: Clark Gable (Actor), Yvonne De Carlo (Actor), Raoul Walsh (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Band of Angels (DVD)', "Academy Award winners Clark Gable and Sidney Poitier star with Yvonne DeCarlo in this story of an aristocratic young woman who falls from theheights of Southern society to the absolute bottom--and of the forbiddenlove that redeems her in A Band of Angels.New Orleans, 1860s. Southern Belle Amantha Starr is away atan exclusive girls' school when her father dies unexpectedly. She learnsshe is now penniless: Her father had lost everything--their money, theirplantation and their slaves. Worse, the truth comes out that her motherwas part African American--and under the law of Louisiana, Amantha mustbe sold into slavery. She is purchased by plantation owner Hamish Bond, who soon falls in love with his beautiful new slave--earningAmantha the resentment of overseer Rau Ru . When the UnitedStates' Civil War breaks out, Bond loses his plantation and reveals tothe newly freed Amantha that he yearned his fortune as a slave trader.", ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Sidney Poitier, in the beginning of his career, fires up the screen in the Civil-War-era bodice-ripper', 'Band of Angels', '. The movie follows Amantha Starr (Yvonne De Carlo, later on', 'The Munsters', "), a Southern belle whose fortunes fall when her father dies and family secrets come to light. She ends up under the protection of Hamish Bond (Clark Gable, close to the end of his long, remarkable career and still radiating an easy, charismatic masculinity), a plantation owner with secrets of his own. For much of the movie, slavery and the Civil War are just a colorful backdrop for a turgid romance--but just when you're ready to write the movie off, a scene unexpectedly digs into something more emotionally and politically complex. Poitier plays Bond's plantation foreman; every time he appears,", 'Band of Angels', "turns into something fierce and promising. That promise never fully takes hold--Clark Gable is the movie's hero, not Poitier--but those crackling scenes (combined with a surprisingly sexual frankness in a 1957 feature) make", 'Band of Angels', 'more than just an embarrassing collection of manly swaggers, flashing eyes, and lugubrious spirituals.', '--Bret Fetzer'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Love & Romance, Drama, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Torin Thatcher, Sidney Poitier, Andrea King, Robert Penn Warren, Clark Gable, William Forrest, Ben Roberts, Ivan Goff, Efrem Zimbalist, Jr., Noreen Corcoran, Tommie Moore, Raoul Walsh, John Twist, Ray Teal, Russell Evans, Yvonne De Carlo, Raymond Bailey, Patric Knowles, Rex Reason, Carolle DrakeTorin Thatcher, Sidney Poitier, Andrea King, Robert Penn Warren, Clark Gable, William Forrest, Ben Roberts, Ivan Goff, Efrem Zimbalist, Jr., Noreen Corcoran, Tommie Moore, Raoul Walsh, John Twist, Ray Teal, Russell Evans, Yvonne De Carlo, Raymond Bailey, Patric Know… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), French (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2289544', 'Director': 'Raoul Walsh', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 30, 2007', 'Actors': 'Clark Gable, Yvonne De Carlo, Sidney Poitier, Efrem Zimbalist, Jr., Patric Knowles', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'John Twist, Ivan Goff, Ben Roberts', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Arrived in expected time - quality of movie was good - a little jumpy during the opening credits but that actually may have been the original film.
Interesting to watch this story through modern eyes. Review Title: Arrived in expected time - quality of movie was good - a little jumpy during the opening credits but ... Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Arrived on time - was packaged nicely - I was very pleased. Arro=ived on time - was [packaged nicely - I was very pleased Masterpiece: Poldark . (Actor, Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama ['Product Description', 'Ross Poldark rides again in a swashbuckling new adaptation of the hit series that helped launch MASTERPIECE in the 1970s. Aidan Turner (The Hobbit) stars as Captain Poldark, who returns to Cornwall after the American Revolution to find that his fighting days are far from over. Feeling betrayed by everything he loves, Ross must rebuild his life, embarking on a risky business venture and finding love where he least expects it. This set is the complete First Season.', 'Review', "Sweeping, Stirring, Rousing, Lush. --Mike Hale, New York TimesBecause for anyone thinking the genre was beginning to be played out, 'Masterpiece' has once again dug into its vault, and unearthed another gem. --Brian Lowry, VarietyPoldark Fills PBS's Downton Abbey Void --K.L. Connie Wang, Parade"] {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Color, Widescreen, DVD Single, NTSC', 'Run time': '8 hours', 'Release date': 'July 7, 2015', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'PBS (Direct)', 'Number of discs': '2'} Highly recommend this series Five Stars {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} It's no Downton Abbey - and a bit predictable at times, but it still was enjoyable to watch. Four Stars {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bruce Goodison', 'Robert Quinn'], 'Producers': ['Rebecca Eaton', 'Francis Hopinkson', 'Catherine Oldfield', 'Sue de Beauvoir', 'Jeremy Gwilt'], 'Starring': ['Samantha Bond', 'Claire Calbraith', 'Claire Rushbrook'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} well written and acted. Four Stars The War Bride Drama, Historical, Romance ['English seamstress Lily (Anna Friel) marries and has a child with a Canadian soldier, but their new life is shattered when he ships out to fight in WWII. Shortly after, Lily and her newborn daughter are invited to come and live with his family in Canada, where conditions are not as splendid as he had described.'] {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lyndon Chubbuck'], 'Producers': ['Douglas Berquist', 'Christopher Courtney', 'Torsten Leschly', 'Alistair MacLean-Clark', 'Jordan Randell', 'Molly Orr Rosenberg', 'Melvyn Singer', 'William Talmadge'], 'Starring': ['Anna Friel', 'Brenda Fricker', 'Molly Parker']} I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow and the situations predictable, which I know doesn't sound like much of an endorsement, but it was extremely well acted and the slower pace helps to build the characters so you begin to care what happens to these people. If you like WWII movies give it a chance I don't think you will be disappointed. I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow ... {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brett Haley'], 'Producers': ['Brett Haley', 'Rebecca Green', 'Laura D. Smith Ireland'], 'Starring': ['Blythe Danner', 'Martin Starr', 'June Squibb'], 'Studio': ['PREFERRED CONTENT']} Wasn't a" great" movie but it was a pleasant diversion for an evening. Great cast, all of them playing the usual characters but they played off each other well. It is a little sad so be prepared. actual_interaction.text:
Arrived in expected time - quality of movie was good - a little jumpy during the opening credits but that actually may have been the original film.
Interesting to watch this story through modern eyes.
description: Academy Award winners Clark Gable and Sidney Poitier star with Yvonne DeCarlo in this story of an aristocratic young woman who falls from theheights of Southern society to the absolute bottom--and of the forbiddenlove that redeems her in A Band of Angels.New Orleans, 1860s. Southern Belle Amantha Starr is away atan exclusive girls' school when her father dies unexpectedly. She learnsshe is now penniless: Her father had lost everything--their money, theirplantation and their slaves. Worse, the truth comes out that her motherwas part African American--and under the law of Louisiana, Amantha mustbe sold into slavery. She is purchased by plantation owner Hamish Bond, who soon falls in love with his beautiful new slave--earningAmantha the resentment of overseer Rau Ru . When the UnitedStates' Civil War breaks out, Bond loses his plantation and reveals tothe newly freed Amantha that he yearned his fortune as a slave trader.
Sidney Poitier, in the beginning of his career, fires up the screen in the Civil-War-era bodice-ripper
. The movie follows Amantha Starr (Yvonne De Carlo, later on

), a Southern belle whose fortunes fall when her father dies and family secrets come to light. She ends up under the protection of Hamish Bond (Clark Gable, close to the end of his long, remarkable career and still radiating an easy, charismatic masculinity), a plantation owner with secrets of his own. For much of the movie, slavery and the Civil War are just a colorful backdrop for a turgid romance--but just when you're ready to write the movie off, a scene unexpectedly digs into something more emotionally and politically complex. Poitier plays Bond's plantation foreman; every time he appears,

turns into something fierce and promising. That promise never fully takes hold--Clark Gable is the movie's hero, not Poitier--but those crackling scenes (combined with a surprisingly sexual frankness in a 1957 feature) make
more than just an embarrassing collection of manly swaggers, flashing eyes, and lugubrious spirituals.
